Salesforce Administrator - Based in Richmond (with regular travel to our Glen Waverley office)

Who Are We

We are a tech company that exists to help businesses succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. We believe businesses can do amazing things and it's our job to help them. This is MYOB.

The team
You’ll be part of our Engineering and Experience team who are responsible for building innovative products that help businesses become more successful. With the latest tech at our disposal and an agile mindset, we’re empowered to experiment, play and really make a difference.

Are you ready to go boldly?

The opportunity
Working closely with our sales teams to provide operational support of our Salesforce implementation as well as providing enhancement work to drive efficiency within the business.

What You’ll Get Up To In This Role
  • Perform all ongoing system administration functions, including configuring security settings, user profiles, work flow rules, custom objects, custom fields, etc.
  • Provide functional support for Salesforce dashboards, reports, forms, custom objects, custom formula fields, field dependencies, validation rules, workflows, and approval processes for automated alerts, field updates, and email generation
  • Responsible for the specification and development of business reports and dashboards, assisting users in the development and maintenance of their reporting needs
  • Provide support for Salesforce data clean-up procedures, including data migrations and bulk data uploads
  • Troubleshoot, track and resolve Salesforce related incidents & requests reported by internal and external users and ensure resolution
  • Manage ongoing support requests and administrative needs with third party vendors
  • Create and maintain documentation on processes, policies, application configuration and knowledge base related materials for internal and external users

  • Siebel highly regarded
  • Process mapping and improvement
  • Strong analytical experience, ability to interpret data
  • Data cleansing highly regarded
  • Project based work where you have been involved with integration partners
  • Developer skills would be a bonus (e.g. apex or visualforce)
You love what you do and bring passion to the teams you join!

  • Underwriting new business and renewal risks within defined underwriting authority

  • New facilitator opportunities delivering the Berry Street Education Model
  • Highly competitive salary\xa0+ $10,500 motor vehicle allowance + great salary packing benefits

  • Based in Richmond with regional/interstate travel

\xa0

We are seeking a dynamic educator with significant experience as a school leader, coach, or mentor to facilitate whole-school learning.

The Berry Street Education Model provides schools and community service organisations with the training, curriculum and strategies to engage the most challenging students. It is unique because it equips schools to promote cognitive and behavioural change, thereby engaging the young person in learning and progressing their academic achievement.


The Berry Street Education Model Senior Trainer will hold four key responsibilities:

  1. Delivery of BSEM training and professional learning within schools and community service organisations
  2. Consultation to school staff and school leadership
  3. Public speaking

  • Trauma-informed teaching and learning strategies
  • Wellbeing / Positive Education / Positive Psychology
  • Instructional planning and delivery
  • Academic practice toward significant academic outcomes
  • Embedding whole-school approaches
  • Experience in designing and delivering professional learning sessions for school staff

Berry Street are also committed to cultural safety, inclusion and empowerment of Aboriginal children, their families and communities. 839158757:
[

Laravel/PHP developer (Mid level)?

Company Name inoutput Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 47 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

inoutput is a close-knit team of software engineers based in the back streets of Collingwood. We architect and implement elegant software – and work on interesting projects.


We don't wear shirts or ties. We are all technologists and full-stack engineers, self proclaimed fun people, we keep solid programming standards and practises, and encourage knowledge sharing and collaboration.


inoutput works on interesting software. We don't do "websites", we build mobile & web apps for businesses. Ranging from real-time public transport services, mobile applications for worker communication, and risk management solutions for the health sector, we build software that is used daily by our clients.. and we love doing it.


inoutput is looking to hire an experienced mid level PHP/Laravel developer to join our team.

We're passionate about development and looking for a dev that shares our love of code and devops, and also has a passion for business automation. We cover a wide range of tech, from mobile through to big data enterprise systems, with a focus on elegant software engineering over pumping out websites.


We're looking for a full-stack developer fluent in Laravel, experience with at least one JS framework (e.g. Vue/React/Angular/Ember/Blah) and solid DB and software architecture skills.


If you're a software engineer and looking to make a move in an environment where you can grow your skills, learn from experienced devs, and get access to some fun projects - then this could be exactly what you're looking for.


We are looking for a mid-level dev with the following strengths in their toolkit:

  • Laravel / PHP
  • Javascript (strong vanilla JS skills, and ideally a framework e.g. Vue.js)
  • HTML5/CSS3
  • Git, PRs, Code Review, Automated
  • DB - Good SQL skills, DB design and architecture experience
  • Devops experience (vagrant/automated deployment etc)


This is a full-time position, with a salary range of $70,000 - $79,999 pa (incl. super) based on experience, You will be working with us on-site in our Collingwood office.


We try hard to build a great team, and we are looking for someone who is a great fit.


Important: only applicants that submit a request to the REST API endpoint below will be considered


To apply send us a POST request to http://private-36f76-inoutputapply.apiary-mock.com/apply
with the following data (header content-type "application/json").


{ "name": "Your name", "email": "Email address", "contact_number": "Best contact number", "about": "Let us know about you", "links": [ "http://link-one.com", "http://link-two.com", "http://link-three.com" ], "question_answer": "Who knows?"}

Populate the "links" array with any resume/personal-site/github/example work etc. anything you would like us to take a look at.


To find out the question (for "question_answer" property), hit up the same URL using a GET request. Also follow-up with an email to hireme@inoutput.io, and let us know a bit more about you, and your experience and interests.


From there we will have a phone interview, and if all goes well – get you in to meet the team and have a face-to-face. There will be some programming challenges, but nothing *too* challenging we hope.


Cheers. See ya soon.

Business Analyst

Company Name ME Bank Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 468 views

Job description


Let's talk about ME
 We're not like other banks.

ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future. We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people.

To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support and environment to be heard. ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.

We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.

Let's talk about YOU
 With experience working with stakeholders across all levels, you're a solid influencer who has a track record driving successful outcomes. You genuinely care about understanding your stakeholders' true needs, and take this into consideration for each and every decision made.

You bring a wealth of cards and payment knowledge plus solid experience that will compliment new and exciting initiatives- apply NOW! Should you have dabbled in Base Global even better!

As a proactive team member, you happily jump in and assist when required to swarm around blockers, coaching and guiding other team members and broader stakeholders on business analysis.

If you have a strong desire to be part of an organisation that fosters a culture of collaboration and ownership from its people, perhaps you should apply now?

Let's discuss the ROLE
 If you're passionate about introducing new changes and solving complex problems that directly improves customer's experience, this could be the role for you! Working closely within the Cards and Payments stream, this is a role that requires a highly collaborative individual who has detailed knowledge of Cards and Payment products as well as awareness of current industry standards.

Taking full end-to-end ownership of business, functional and non-functional requirements, you'll also negotiate priorities and resolve conflicts across the business. Providing functional expertise to solution designers, developers, testers and business groups, you'll demonstrate outstanding written and verbal communication skills as well as proficient stakeholder management skills.

You'll proactively collate information, documents and analyse business needs in order to identify opportunities for improvements in business operations and processes.

About the Perks
 At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:

  • Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.
  • The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.
  • Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.
  • To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.
  • ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.
  • Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.


Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.

I want those Converse (and the job)!
 If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.

Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including police checks, reference checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates; however will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the job.

Job description

We are searching for a talented Delivery Principal to join our rapidly growing team in Melbourne.


About Us:


  • Mantel Group is a house of brands company with two businesses:

    • DigIO – a digital services business providing technology consulting, software development and design services

    • Eliiza – a consulting and development company specialising in Artificial Intelligence

  • Seriously, we mean it when we say our people are our greatest asset so we go to extreme lengths to provide an environment where everyone can be their best.

  • We’re values-led and practical in the way we work towards creating value for our customers and our people.

  • Whilst we’re hard workers, we’re a fun-loving bunch and keep things balanced between work and life :)


About the role:


In your role as a Delivery Principal you’ll be accountable for building a culture of continuous improvement that fosters the development of a delivery capability that sets DigIO apart from others. You will be the champion of different delivery methods and not afraid to try new things that will have a positive impact on our clients and team.


Within our company no two days will be the same, whether this be day to day tasks, the industry we are working in or the type of work our teams are doing. That is why the most important skills you possess will be adaptability in your leadership and approaches based on the context of the situation.


Here’s an overview of some of the responsibilities you may have:


  • Define and develop the business value of the Delivery capability within DigIO so that our clients clearly understand how our delivery practices differ from others.

  • Define and implement delivery principles and a lean agile delivery framework to ensure that DigIO teams are successful

  • Creation of a career development framework to assist delivery team members with their professional development, whilst also providing mentoring and support

  • Develop delivery accelerators to get Digio teams up and running faster from a delivery perspective.

  • Develop a data driven continuous improvement culture to challenge and improve existing delivery processes.

  • Review the health of DigIO engagements, with a specific emphasis on the quality and frequency of communications to clients; specifically senior leaders.

  • Provide proactive coaching to mentoring members of the DigIO delivery team on lean agile methods and principles to assist them with \xa0delivery on client site.

  • Build a cohesive, collaborative and support Delivery team, that develop, improve and champion our delivery framework and DigIO principles with the broader DigIO team and our customers.

  • Develop and review of commercial documents

  • Support the management of client delivery escalations

  • You may be required from time to time to consult to, or lead the delivery of key DigIO projects, with the intent that the role will also perform billable customer work.


About you:


  • Experience at a senior level managing a Professional Services team with a proven track record of both delivery and client management

  • Experience in the delivery of custom software development projects in ASX100 or equivalent organisations

  • Strong commercial acumen with demonstrated experience in the development and management of commercial agreements

  • Highly developed executive level reporting and communication skills and an ability to provide relevant and timely information to stakeholders

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with strong leadership and communication skills

  • Strong time management skills with ability to prioritise workloads under pressure and meet deadlines

  • A self-starter who is hands on and knows how to find answers and work with ambiguity

  • Values driven and practical in your approach



What’s on offer


  • You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective

  • We have a culture of trust. We set clear expectations, provide feedback and opportunities and support you to grow

  • We don’t do policies or performance reviews or hierarchies or bureaucracy

  • We’re growing, so there will be plenty of opportunities to grow your career with us as we expand

  • The building we work in has kombucha, beer, cider on tap, plenty of open space including a rooftop deck and heaps of activities (like yoga, meditation and talks on leading topics) to get involved in to give you a break throughout the day

  • We trust you to get the job done and can offer flexible working arrangements

  • We are located in the heart of the CBD where there’s plenty of transportation options to make getting to and from work a breeze

  • You’ll get all the tools you need - a new iphone or Google phone, a laptop, and a lot of branded swag - t-shirts, hoodies, umbrellas, water bottle….

  • Lots of social activities - so far this year we have had regular breakfasts, lunches and drinks, hotly contested table tennis competition, twice weekly squash competitions, regular games nights, ski trip, Grand Prix

  • A learning organisation - we make a huge investment of time and money into our learning - attending conferences, hosting and attending ‘brown bag’ lunches, meet ups and supporting individual learning opportunities

  • Genuine support for your wellbeing including unlimited health leave, flu shots, counselling and psychological services, dietitian and financial advice

Job description


This is a 24-Month Max Term role


The IT Service Operations Lead will drive the operational performance across all IT services within the Digital Information Management domain.


A bit about your role


In your day-to-day, you will be responsible for protecting the integrity, performance, availability, and reliability of our business intelligence and reporting platforms. Those include the data warehouse and other tools such as Netezza, Tableau, Alteryx and the Splunk log repositories along with the associated add-ons such as user behaviour analytics.


You'll be working closely with internal teams and external strategic partners in order to understand operational requirements, resolve issues and ensure a high level of service. Your contribution in the role is primarily focussed upon stakeholder management, partner management, and service management with some elements in continuous improvement.


A bit about you


You should demonstrate your experience leading cross-functional teams to manage problems, incidents, and changes. In addition, you will also bring onboard your strong entrepreneurial drive as well as a demonstrated ability to achieve ambitious goals and drive operational excellence for a set of internal customers.


Your strong working knowledge of Spunk and data warehousing is very useful to be successful in this role.


Life at nbn


At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.


Continue the conversation


If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.


nbn is a fast-moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!


At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn™ network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

This role is primarily responsible to asses, prioritise and accept applications for planned access to the sub-transmission, distribution and LV network. You will be responsible to produce detailed switching instructions and to provide safe access to the Network. If the successful applicant has appropriate authorisations they may be utilised to undertake switching operations for planned and/or unplanned events

\xa0

Key responsibilities will focus around:


  • Producing clear and concise Sub Transmission, High Voltage and Low Voltage operational switching instructions to provide safe access to the network
  • Performing system analysis to determine outage requirements
  • Delivering project outcomes with minimum impact on system security & customers
  • Providing advice and direction to internal personnel, external operational authorities and major customers
  • Utilising customer information systems regarding customer outages
  • Subject to the level of authorisations, undertake switching operations as required
  • Certificate of Technology (Electrical)/ Certificate IV Electrical/ Associate Diploma Electrical Engineering or equivalent tertiary based qualification or experience
  • Strong system skills, ideally with OMS, GIS, SAP and DMS
  • Experience working on a HV electrical network in a technical role
  • Previous experience in a Control and Operations environment would be an advantage


Required skills and experience:

\xa0

  • Certificate of Technology (Electrical)/ Certificate IV Electrical/ Associate Diploma Electrical Engineering or equivalent tertiary based qualification or experience
  • Strong system skills, ideally with OMS, GIS, SAP and DMS
  • Experience working on a HV electrical network in a technical role
  • Previous experience in a Control and Operations environment would be an advantage

\xa0

Your career with CitiPower and Powercor:

\xa0

When you join our business, your work-life balance and career development are high priorities. We place emphasis on your development through diverse training programs, leadership courses and internal opportunities.

\xa0

Some of our benefits:

\xa0

  • Exposure to industry leading practices within a strong and stable company
  • A great incentives package including an annual performance bonus, health and fitness subsidy, salary packaging options and much more….
  • A supportive team culture
    \xa0\xa0 \xa0

If you possess the required skills and experience and you are looking for a fantastic career opportunity please submit your application by\xa0C.O.B\xa0Friday 14th September\xa02018.

846436981:
[

Trade Marketing Coordinator

Company Name Moose Toys Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Moose Toys exists to make children happy. The team has innovation in their DNA and are famous for the design, development and manufacture of award winning toys that continue to disrupt the market!

Moose Toys dominates in categories including collectables, craft, dolls, games and youth electronics featuring much loved brands such as: Shopkins, Little Live Pets, Beados, Happy Places, The Grossery Gang, The Trash Pack and Mighty Beanz and is consistently recognised as the most creative company in the industry.

Moose Toys calls Australia home and has teams across Los Angeles, Hong Kong, China, London, Paris and Vietnam, employing more than 350+ staff and distributing to over 100 countries.

Today, Moose Toys is on the hunt for a Trade Marketing Coordinator

Role Objective

Responsible for providing support to the Trade Marketing Team at Moose Head Office.

Key capabilities

Applying expertise and technical capability: Has the functional and technical knowledge and skills to do the job well and applies this expertise accordingly. Quickly learns new technology. In addition, demonstrates:
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to work with cross-functional teams;
  • Team collaboration with a “can-do” attitude – no task is too big or small;
  • A working knowledge of the product development process;
  • Medium to Advanced Excel capability (V-lookups, formulas, data entry and manipulation);
  • A working knowledge of Adobe creative suite, specifically Adobe Illustrator; and
  • An ability to adhere to, and motivate others to, follow strict deadlines.

Planning and organising: Plans ahead and works in a systematic, timely and organised way, with strong attention to detail. Follows directions and procedures and can also work autonomously. Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers a quality service to the agreed standards.

Analysing and interpreting: Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking. Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues. Applies own expertise effectively. Communicates well (written and verbal).

Adapting and responding to change: Adapts to changing circumstances; tolerates ambiguity; accepts new ideas and change initiatives; adapts interpersonal style to suit different people or situations; shows an interest in new experiences and can work effectively in an entrepreneurial and fast paced environment.

Responsibilities
  • Support the Trade Fair and Key Presentations process by assisting the Trade Marketing team with general administration tasks including but not limited to; excel report preparation & data entry, maintain document and photo filing system, preparing delivery instructions & tracking shipments, ordering presentation supplies, meeting agendas, meeting notes & distribution;
  • Maintain Presentation Schedule/Time Line;
  • Work with key stakeholders to support and/or drive cross-functional internal projects, including sending reminders to Teams on Presentation requirements;
  • Help create and maintain SKU lists including running reports and analysing data;
  • Provide concise lists for Toy Fairs to advise set up team what is coming from Melbourne and Hong Kong;
  • Create pack down Lists and follow up on all items being shipped/received;
  • Assist in set up and maintenance of Model Tracker, including following up on requests to ship and ensuring return of borrowed models;
  • Coordinate and track major assets being sent from one location to another, including pull-up banners, standees, etc;
  • Maintain records in JDE, including raising Purchase Orders;
  • Assist in maintaining the Toy Fair Budget Tracker;
  • Assist with artwork management process on Toy Box;
  • Assist in packing shipments for Toy Fairs including set up of Tool Kits for new shows/regions. Ensure returned and replenished; and
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders as required.

Perks And Benefits

Moose Toys prides itself on valuing team members and constantly pushes for best practice by offering a casual fun environment, great benefits and recognition programs.

Moose Toys recognizes the importance of health and well-being and offers a fully serviced gym, personal training, 30 day challenges and Yoga as well as healthy snacks for the team. We also have “bring your dog to work” each Wednesday and Friday, Children Holiday programs, Veggie patches and the Employee of the Month and Year awards to name a few!

If this role sounds like you APPLY today!
  • Minimum of four years’ experience in an administrative or support position, preferably within a product or design team; and
  • Exposure to Event/Trade Shows an advantage.

836699261:
[

Coordinator Recreation

Company Name Manningham City Council Company Location Doncaster, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


  • Key leadership role
  • Recreation planning and service delivery
  • Newly created role, Band 8, Full time

At Manningham Council, we are people who invest in people. We’re a values based organisation who has a big responsibility to deliver 100 diverse services to our community.

We’ve also set ourselves a big goal – to be the best Council in Victoria. So we are embracing new technology and improving our customer’s experiences. It’s a very exciting time to be working at Manningham.

Working here is often challenging where no day is the same. You will have the opportunity to take ownership of your work, have your ideas heard and your achievements acknowledged.

What will you do?

The Coordinator Recreation will provide a high level of dynamic and contemporary leadership to a team of multidisciplinary professionals to plan and deliver integrated, active and passive recreation and leisure services that promote and enhance the participation and health of Manningham.

You will lead the master/management planning of recreational sites and proactively address the recreation needs of our diverse community by engaging and collaborating with sporting clubs, community groups and other key stakeholders. The role will have service delivery oversight of our key leisure and recreation management contracts, including Manningham’s high ball stadiums and leisure facilities.

Who are you?

  • Tertiary qualified in leisure, recreation or other relevant field.
  • Significant experience in leading a customer focused team in planning and delivering integrated recreation and leisure services to the community.
  • A people leader who is able to lead and inspire service units to meet objective and deliverables.
  • Experienced in monitoring and managing service delivery of significant external contracts.
  • Able to develop and deliver work programs and systems that successfully support flexible work practices, agility and financially responsive practice.
  • Flexible to respond to changing priorities and able to complete tasks within tight timeframes.
  • A problem solver, able to resolve complex operational and service delivery issues to meet the needs of internal and external stakeholders
  • A negotiator, able to influence outcomes to achieve organisational objectives.
  • Knowledgeable in government, and local government organisations

Find out more!

If you have any questions about the position please contact Leigh Harrison, Director Assets and Engineering on 9840 9275. For all other enquiries contact the HR Officer on 9840 9219 or email jobs@manningham.vic.gov.au

Your application for this position should be addressed to Leigh Harrison, Director Assets and Engineering and can be submitted via the form below.

Applications close at 10am Monday 10 September 2018.
